New Records: Jakob Poeltl had one of the best games of his career, scoring at least 23 points and hauling in at least 16 rebounds for the first time.
Key Match Events: Malik Beasley led the Pistons with 20 points.
Jakob Poeltl finished with 25 points, 19 rebounds, and 3 blocks.
The Raptors turned an 8-point halftime deficit into a lead in the third quarter.
Malik Beasley helped the Pistons draw even at 82 early in the fourth quarter.
The Raptors made a late-game comeback but ultimately fell short.
Pre-Game Insights: The Raptors were without key players Scottie Barnes, Bruce Brown, Kelly Olynyk, and Ja'Kobe Walter.
Post-Match Reflections: Despite fighting back from an 8-point deficit in the fourth quarter, the Raptors ultimately fell short.
Fans are hoping their hearts are not broken when the Draft Lottery rolls around.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Raptors' losing streak extended to 6 games.
The Raptors have the worst record in the NBA, being the first to reach 10 and 11 losses.
